title: Opportunity Cost
content:
Opportunity Cost
[机会成本]
Starting today, I will introduce a series of mental models.
[从今天开始将介绍一系列的思维模式。]
The first model is opportunity cost.
[第一个模式是机会成本。]
Simply put, opportunity cost is the benefit you forgo by not choosing the next best alternative.
[通俗地讲呢，机会成本就是你做一个选择时所放弃下一个最好选项带来的收益。]
For example, if you spend ¥50 on a two-hour movie, your opportunity cost might be that ¥50 plus what you could have gained in those two hours by studying, exercising, or having dinner with friends.
[比如说选择花 50 块钱去看一场 2 小时的电影。这个选择的机会成本就可能是 50 块钱加上这两小时做其他事情的收益，比如学习、运动、与朋友聚餐等等。]
This matters because time is an exclusive resource.
[因为时间是个排他性的资源。]
Key points to understand about this model:
[关于这个思维模式关键要知道：]
When making choices, pay attention not only to explicit costs but also to implicit costs.
[平时做选择的时候，除了看显性成本也要关注隐性成本。]
There’s also the concept of secondary usage cost: for instance, buying a tutorial incurs an even greater time cost to study it.
[这里还有个二次使用成本的概念，比如买了一本教程，后续学习的时间成本其实是更大的。]
Second, chasing immediate gains may mean sacrificing long-term benefits, so more reflection is necessary.
[第二点就是平时追求眼前利益的时候可能放弃了长远的利益，所以需要多思考。]
How can you apply this model in daily life?
[平时怎么用好这个思维模式呢？]
1. When deciding, don’t just ask “What will I gain?” but also “What will I lose?”
[1. 做决策时不要只问“我会得到什么”，也要问“我将失去什么？”]
2. Ask yourself: “If I don’t make this choice, where else could I allocate these resources?”
[2. 多问一句：“如果我不做这个选择，我可以把资源用在哪儿？”]
3. Train yourself to evaluate alternatives, which helps improve decision quality.
[3. 训练自己思考替代方案的价值，这有助于提高决策质量]
